Subjective: Fatigue for 2 months. Reports persistent tiredness, waking up tired. Sleeps well but feels superficial sleep. No clear cause or acute onset. Still able to work and exercise (rock climbing 2-3x/week). No weight loss or appetite changes. No shortness of breath, chest pain, or palpitations. No joint pain or swelling. No recent illness or fever. No smoking or alcohol use. ICE: Concern about rheumatism or underlying condition. Morning stiffness noted.
Objective: BP: 110/60. HR: 40-60, bradycardia (athlete's heart). Lungs: clear. Abdomen: soft, non-tender. Back: mild discomfort in lower spine, no specific tenderness. No joint inflammation or swelling. Neurological exam normal.
Assessment: Chronic fatigue syndrome. Ruled out: Anemia, thyroid dysfunction, rheumatoid arthritis, cardiac issues.
Plan: 1. Blood tests: CBC, TSH, CRP, ESR. 2. Follow-up phone appointment after results. 3. Advice: Continue current activities, monitor symptoms. 4. Safety net: Contact if severe symptoms develop or if no improvement.
